p: The drug arbutin is a prodrug of hydroquinone. Chemically arbutin is glycosylated hydroquinone, an inhibitor of melanin formation and a skin-lightening agent. Hydroquinones are known tyrosinase inhibitors, and hence arbutin is repurposed to treat melanogenesis or hyperpigmentation ( 29). Arbutin is officially used therapeutically for hyperpigmentation and other skin related problems ( 30). The data from this work suggests that arbutin can be repurposed to treat COVID-19 if explored further. The drug terbutaline sometimes used to prevent premature labour, is also the medicine for asthma, wheezing and COPD ( 31).
